headline: Republican Senate candidate Herschel Walker failed for months to report millions in earnings
author: Madison Hall
sentences:
Herschel Walker amended report
Contributed by Insider Staff (Insider Inc.)
p. 1
 5/19/22, 8:38 AM eFD: Annual Report for 2021 - Walker, Herschel https://efdsearch.senate.gov/search/view/annual/11506d2b-61d5-4b23-bbfb-e6b7031297ec/ 1/23 United States Senate Financial Disclosures Candidate Report (Amendment 1) Mr. Herschel Walker State of Candidacy: GA | Candidacy Commenced: 08/24/2021  Filed 05/15/2022 @ 10:22 PM The following statements were checked before filing: I certify that the statements I have made on this form are true, complete and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief.

Comments 1 07/15/2020 Speech $10,000.00 Supreme Lending Atlanta, GA Self n/a 2 08/24/2020 Speech $22,500.00 Republican Attorneys General AssociationSea Island, Ga Self n/a 3 08/28/2020 Speech $10,000.00 EA Sports - Madden Redwood City, CA Self n/a 4 02/11/2021 Speech $25,000.00 Boys & Girls Club Gainesville, GA Self n/a 5 02/19/2021 Speech $35,000.00 All Sports Association Destin, FL Self n/a

Five months later, Walker amended his candidate report to show that he brought in an additional $3.2 million from an "H. Walker Enterprises."

Dylan Hedtler-Gaudette, government affairs manager at the Project on Government Oversight, told Insider that Walker amending his report so late in the game undermines "the basic compact between a person running for office and the people they are trying to recruit to support them."

According to the US Senate Select Committee on Ethics, candidates are required by law to submit a candidate report detailing their honoraria payments, income, assets, liabilities, compensation, and other personal financial details within 30 days of becoming a candidate.

Walker's original candidate report, filed in December 2021, listed him and his spouse cumulatively earning $927,886 from late 2020 to the end of 2021 through various corporations, including a $100,000 salary from "Renaissance Man Food Services, LLC."

Honoraria Payments or Payments to Charity in Lieu of Honoraria Did any individual or organization pay you or your spouse more than $200, or donate any amount to a charity on your or your spouses behalf, for an article, speech, or appearance?

According to H. Walker Enterprises' website, the company's stated mission is to "establish a business structure capable of servicing food service, corporate and retail customers with a variety of products on a national level."
"There's some potential a voter who may find him supportable may have already contributed some money on the basis of the information they had at that point," Hedtler-Gaudette said.
He amended his overall income in the disclosure to $4.1 million, more than four times higher than the original candidate report, according to Insider's review of the documents.

Republican US Senate hopeful Herschel Walker neglected to report nearly $3.2 million in earnings in a federal financial disclosure, waiting five months to amend the sum.
But candidates rarely face significant penalties  if any at all  for misstating their income, even if the amount involved is large.
It's unclear what role Walker currently plays in the company, his campaign report simply notes it as "partnership distributions."
He said that voters and supporters who donate assume that the information listed in a candidate's original report is complete.
Walker, who is supported by former President Donald Trump, is expected to win Georgia's six-way Republican primary on May 24.
If Walker wins, he's almost assured to face incumbent Sen. Raphael Warnock, a Democrat, in the November general election.
Representatives from Walker's campaign and H. Walker Enterprises did not respond to Insider's requests for comment.
